My Work

// Some of the projects I've worked on

Visit

Technologies used: React, Redux, NYT API

Description: Mobile Friendly New York Times API Project

What I Did:

  • Allow users to search for an article, articles are fetched using the NYT API.
  • Displays important information about an article such as a snippet, section, and keywords.
  • Currently working on adding bookmark functionality and searching based off an article's keywords.
Visit

Technologies used: React, Redux, Express

Description: 1stDibs Front End React Challenge

What I Did:

  • Allow users to add or remove items from their favorites, which are stored in a json file.
  • Items can be favorited from both the home and single item pages.
  • Load more functionality fetches additional items on the home page.
Visit

Technologies used: React, Redux

Description: A Progressive Web App that fetches robot photos from Robohash.org and allows users to search through them.

What I Did:

  • Transformed the site into a Progressive Web App by implementing HTTPS, caching static files, while improving performance. Tested with Google's Lighthouse. Here's a snippet of the report.
  • Utilized the Robohash API to serve robot images onto the site.
Github

Technologies used: React, Node, Express, PostgreSQL, Stripe API

Description: A web application focused on helping people save money using money pools and the Stripe API.

What I Did:

  • Managed the projectâ€™s Github repo and ensured all pull requests were compatible with existing code.
  • Implemented NodeJS and Stripe API to allow users to make payments to their corresponding money pool and stored transaction information for future reference in the database.
  • Used PostgreSQL as a database to establish relationships between users, groups, and payments information.
Github

Technologies used: React, Node, Express, PostgreSQL, Webpack / Babel

Description: A school management system that aims to simplify the academic processes and transactions between professors and students.

What I Did:

  • Minimized processes for students and professors, such as registering/withdrawing classes, submitting assignments, and checking grades using ReactJS and Bootstrap on the client side.
  • Integrated NodeJS, ExpressJS, and PostgreSQL on the server side to manage user requests and established one-to-one and many-to-many relationships between students, professors and schools.
Github

Technologies used: React, NYC Open Data API, CSS Animations

Description: A web application that allows users to explore New York City restaurants based on cuisine, zip code, and health inspection grade.

What I Did:

  • Researched and executed queries to the NYC Open Data API to verify information displayed on the client side.
  • Implemented React components to render out restaurant information using CSS Grids.
